title: Netherlands vs. US: Two exciting young teams go head-to-head for place in World Cup quarterfinals
description: The round of 16 match on Saturday between the US Men's National Team and the Netherlands is one of the more intriguing clashes in the first knockout round of Qatar 2022.

title: 'I would even say sick': Ukrainian FM describes bloody packages with animal eyes sent to embassies
description: CNN's Matthew Chance speaks to Ukraine's foreign minister Dmytro Kuleba about more than a dozen letters containing explosives or animal parts sent to Ukrainian diplomats around the world.

title: What is Strep A, the common bacterium that has killed 6 children in the UK?
description: Health officials in the United Kingdom are advising parents and schools to watch for Strep A infections following the recent deaths of six children.

title: Soccer player mourns friend who rights group says was killed for celebrating US soccer win
description: An activist group tells CNN that Iranian regime forces killed 27-year-old Mehran Samaak for celebrating the US soccer win over Iran. Iranian police denied that Samak was killed by authorities and announced the arrest of several suspects, Iran's state aligned Tasmin news agency reported. CNN's Jomana Karadsheh has the story.

title: Brazilian football legend Pelé being treated for a respiratory infection, but in stable condition at hospital
description: Brazilian football legend Pelé is being treated for a "respiratory infection," according to a statement by the Albert Einstein Jewish Hospital in São Paulo on Friday.

title: 'No boat in sight': Stranded cruise ship passenger recalls confusion, unknown creature
description: In an interview with "Good Morning America," James Michael Grimes talked about his ordeal at sea after falling off a Carnival cruise ship in the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Cameroon scores late winner against Brazil at Qatar 2022 but fails to qualify for knockout stages
This $600,000 half human, half goat statue honors Elon Musk
description: A group of cryptocurrency entrepreneurs from Elon GOAT Token built this statue featuring Elon Musk's head attached to a goat's body sitting on a rocket. The group said this $600,000 creation is to recognize Musk's "commitment to Cryptocurrency."

title: Lawmakers brawl, throw chairs after male MP slaps female politician
description: A brawl broke out in Senegal's parliament as lawmakers butted heads over Senegalese President Macky Sall potentially seeking a third term.

title: The 'yes, but' economy. Yes, we're worried about recession — but the economy remains resilient
description: Each week brings head-scratching contradictory news about the economy, and this past week was no different, with a batch of economic reports showing that — despite the recession talk — the US economy shows remarkable resilience.

title: Jury to begin deliberations in Harvey Weinstein sexual assault trial
description: A Los Angeles jury will begin deliberating Friday afternoon in the sexual assault trial of Harvey Weinstein, the former movie producer who is accused of using his Hollywood influence to lure women into private meetings and assault them.

title: CNN anchor tries Pepsi and milk. See her reaction
description: CNN anchor Ana Cabrera takes a sip of "Pilk," a combination of Pepsi and milk, following Lindsay Lohan's new campaign for Pepsi.

title: Opinion: I'm a volcanologist. Here's what this Mauna Loa eruption will teach us
description: When Mauna Loa volcano on the island of Hawaii started erupting on Sunday night, many people were already waiting for it. For months, the scientists at the US Geological Survey (USGS) Hawaiian Volcano Observatory (HVO) have been noticing inflation of the ground and an increase in seismic activity at Mauna Loa, indicating the ascent of magma within the volcano's plumbing system toward the surface.

title: Houston police make arrest for murder of rapper Takeoff
description: One man has been arrested and charged with murder in connection to the killing of rapper Takeoff, Houston Police Department Chief Troy Finner announced at a news conference Friday.

title: Biden meets with Prince of Wales in Boston
description: President Joe Biden is meeting with the Prince of Wales in Boston on Friday, greeting him at the John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum before attending a Democratic fundraiser.

title: Iranian athlete's family home demolished by officials, media outlet says
description: The family home of Iranian rock climber Elnaz Rekabi has been demolished, according to the pro-reform news outlet IranWire, after she rose to international prominence this fall for competing with her head uncovered.

title: State Department adds Russian mercenary firm Wagner Group to entities of concern under International Religious Freedom Act
description: The Biden administration is adding the Wagner Group, an infamous private Russian military firm, to the list of Entities of Particular Concern under the International Religious Freedom Act "based on its actions in the Central African Republic," US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Friday.

title: Police give update in killing of Migos rapper Takeoff
Watch the moment teen lifts truck off of dad
description: A California teen is being hailed as a hero for saving his father's life. The teen lifted a truck off his dad, who was trapped underneath the vehicle. Reporter Lee Anne Denyer with affiliate KCRA has the details.

title: 'I want to be in the mix:' Arkansas Governor hints at 2024 run against Trump
description: Arkansas Governor Asa Hutchinson says he is actively thinking about running for president in 2024 and that he doesn't believe Trump is the leader of the GOP.

title: How to stay safe in the snow this winter
description: When the temperature drops and snow begins to fall, many people can't wait to hit the slopes or ice rink. Winter fun is on their minds, not injury. Yet if you don't thoughtfully prepare for your favored activity, it's easy to have a mishap.

title: Europe agrees to cap the price of Russian oil at $60 a barrel
description: The European Union has reached a consensus on the price at which to cap Russian oil just days before the deadline.

title: The Chinese President hinted at relaxing his government's stringent zero-Covid strategy in his first known remarks on protests that have rocked China
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping has acknowledged the frustration within China amid his government's unrelenting zero-Covid strategy, a European Union official told CNN, in his first known remarks on the protests that have erupted across the country in recent days.

title: Why players are wearing masks at the World Cup
description: Is it Batman? Is it Superman? No, it's Son Heung-min flying down the wing for South Korea.

title: US Navy sends a message to adversaries with a rare submarine port visit in Indian Ocean
description: The US military wants its adversaries, as well as allies, to know that, for the first time, a US Navy nuclear-powered ballistic missile submarine docked at the remote island of Diego Garcia in the Indian Ocean as part of an extended months-long deployment.

title: Look of the Week: Willow Smith makes strong case for ultra-low-rise pants
description: The Smith family returned to the red carpet on Wednesday for the premiere of Will Smith's new film "Emancipation," after several low-profile months following his now-infamous Oscars slap. And while nearly everyone showed up in a bold look, from Jada's billowing white high-low gown to Jaden's black-and-white photograph-printed suit, it was 22-year-old Willow who stood out for her melancholic-chic styling, black cropped waistcoat and hip-baring, crystal-embellished trousers.

title: Cruise ship passenger rescued from ocean isn't sure how he went overboard, he tells ABC
description: An Alabama man who rescuers pulled from the Gulf of Mexico hours after he was reported missing from a cruise ship doesn't know how he wound up in the water, he told ABC.

title: Saudia Arabia plans one of the world's biggest airports
description: As Saudi Arabia continues to develop as a tourist destination, it's making plans for big things -- specifically, one of the world's biggest airports.

title: Pain relief from marijuana comes from a belief it helps, study finds
description: Some people suffering pain from cancer and other chronic diseases turn to marijuana to ease their suffering, but much of that relief may come from simply believing weed will help, a new study found.

title: Hate speech dramatically surges on Twitter following Elon Musk takeover, new research shows
description: New Twitter owner Elon Musk declared last month that "hate speech impressions" had dramatically fallen on the platform since he took over.

title: Bear goes on killing spree after finding cocaine in viral film trailer
description: Meet the real "Cocaine Bear." You can even wear him as earrings. CNN's Jeanne Moos unpacks the movie trailer gone viral.

title: Biden signs legislation to avert rail shutdown
description: President Joe Biden on Friday signed legislation to avert a rail shutdown after congressional lawmakers raced to pass the measure amid concerns over the economic danger posed by a possible strike.

title: South Korea and Portugal level, Uruguay leads Ghana
Trump expresses support for Capitol rioters as he continues to embrace extremist groups
description: Former President Donald Trump expressed support for the rioters behind the deadly January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol in a video played during a fundraiser Thursday that was hosted by the Patriot Freedom Project, a group that assists families of those charged in the riot.

title: BTS' RM duets with Erykah Badu and Anderson .Paak on his 'Indigo' album
description: BTS member RM has released a solo album, "Indigo," featuring collaborations with Erykah Badu, Anderson .Paak, Mahalia and more.

title: Brad William Henke, 'Orange Is the New Black' actor, dead at 56
description: Brad William Henke, a veteran character actor known for his work on "Orange Is the New Black" and other series, has died, according to his agent and manager.

title: Hospital patient arrested for allegedly switching off neighbor's 'noisy' oxygen machine
description: A hospital patient has been arrested after she allegedly twice switched off the oxygen equipment on which a fellow patient depended because it was too noisy, German authorities have said.

title: CNN reporter gets up-close look at Mauna Loa's lava flow
description: CNN's David Culver reports near Mauna Loa as the world's largest volcano erupts and lava is slowly moving towards local highways.

title: Top EU official quits US meeting as tension over electric car subsidies persists
description: Efforts to resolve a simmering dispute between Europe and the United States over electric vehicle subsidies stemming from President Joe Biden's Inflation Reduction Act suffered a blow Friday when a top EU official pulled out of talks scheduled for Monday.

title: Paul Whelan calls home from Russia after more than a week without contact
description: Paul Whelan, an American detained in Russia, was able to call home Friday after more than a week without contact with his family, his brother David said.

title: Ukrainian embassies abroad targeted by letter bombs and threats
Top models go head-to-head for hotly anticipated model of the year award
description: The prestigious annual Fashion Awards are back on Monday night, and one of the most hotly anticipated categories is the model of the year prize.

title: Alex Jones has filed for personal bankruptcy
description: Right-wing conspiracy theorist Alex Jones' has filed for personal Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in a Texas court on Friday, according to court documents.

title: Arshad Sharif's family demand justice as they grieve 'kind-hearted' journalist killed in Kenya
description: When a prominent Pakistani investigative journalist was shot dead by Kenyan police on a dirt road on the outskirts of Nairobi, the questions began swirling immediately.

title: Russia told US about Brittney Griner's transfer to penal colony weeks after she was moved
Bloody packages containing 'animal eyes' sent to Ukrainian embassies across Europe
description: Suspicious packages, including blood-soaked envelopes containing "animal eyes," have been sent to Ukrainian embassies and consulates in several European cities, the country's foreign ministry has said.

title: Must-watch videos of the week
China's plans for giant new London embassy unexpectedly rejected by local officials on security grounds
description: China's plans for a giant new embassy opposite the Tower of London have been unanimously rejected by local councillors on the grounds they pose a security risk to local residents, in a surprise decision that comes amid growing concerns over Beijing's diplomatic activity in the United Kingdom.

title: Bodycam footage shows shootout with teenage mass shooting suspect
description: Dramatic body camera footage shows Raleigh police officers in a shootout with a 15-year-old accused of shooting and killing five people, including his older brother, in October of 2022.

title: Chinese police drag resident from his home for refusing quarantine
description: Authorities in the Chinese southern city of Hangzhou have apologized after forcibly taking a man from his home as he allegedly refused to go to a quarantine facility.

title: Formula One cancels 2023 Chinese Grand Prix amid Covid-19 difficulties
description: Formula One has canceled next year's Chinese Grand Prix in light of Covid-19 difficulties, according to a statement released by F1 on Friday.

title: Luxury hotels with a front row to history
description: Hotels offer us the chance to check out of our daily lives into something more glamorous and exhilarating, to wrap ourselves in the drama and allure of past guests and events.

title: Russia told US about Brittney Griner's transfer to penal colony weeks after she was moved
Ukraine claims some Russian units are withdrawing from Zaporizhzhia
description: Some Russian troops are withdrawing from their positions in Ukraine's southern region of Zaporizhzhia, according to Kyiv.

title: Amazon shouldn't be selling the antisemitic film touted by Kyrie Irving
description: It's time for tech and social media companies to take some responsibility for the content they are willing to house on their platforms.

title: Go inside Biden's extravagant and star-studded state dinner
description: President Joe Biden hosted French President Emmanuel Macron at the White House, using the very first state dinner of his presidency to shore up relations with a key American ally whose friendship has until recently been on the rocks. The lavish event drew leaders from Hollywood, fashion and politicians from across the aisle. CNN's Kate Bennett has the details.

title: Air Force set to unveil newest stealth bomber aircraft Friday
description: The Air Force is set to unveil its newest stealth bomber aircraft, the B-21 Raider, on Friday in Palmdale, California. Built by Northrop Grumman, the bomber was named in honor of the "courageous spirit" of airmen who carried out the surprise World War II Doolittle Raid.

title: Alleged serial killer in custody and charged in killings of 4 Indigenous women in Canada, police say
description: Authorities in Winnipeg, Manitoba, believe the murders of four Indigenous women came at the hands of an alleged serial killer now in custody in Canada.

title: CDC's remote-work policy may hinder efforts for agencywide reform, experts say
description: Earlier this year, top leadership at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention began a monumental task: turning the sprawling, labyrinthine organization known for its highly specialized, academically focused scientific research into a sleek, flexible public health response agency primed to serve the American public. It's an attempt to keep the CDC from repeating the mistakes it made while responding to covid-19.

title: Obama mocks Herschel Walker's vampire remark
description: Former President Barack Obama campaigned for Georgia Sen. Raphael Warnock (D) and criticized his opponent Herschel Walker (R) for a remark he made about vampires and werewolves.

title: Did the ball cross the line? Japan reaches World Cup knockout stages with hotly debated goal
description:
• Heavyweights Germany eliminated after extraordinary finale
• Uruguay and Ghana set for epic rematch 12 years after controversial clash

title: Teens' brains aged faster during the first year of the pandemic, study says, and stress may be to blame
description: The brains of US teens have physically changed during the Covid-19 pandemic, aging faster than normal, a new study says.

title: Elton John to headline Glastonbury 2023, the last UK show in his farewell tour
description: Elton John will headline the Glastonbury Festival next summer in what will be the final UK show of his farewell tour, the festival announced Friday.

title: Brazil soccer legend Pele thanks supporters during monthly hospital visit
description: Brazilian soccer legend Pele on Thursday said in an Instagram post that he is at the hospital for a monthly visit and thanked his supporters for the positive messages he has received.

title: Indonesia set to make sex outside marriage an offense punishable with jail time
description: Indonesia's parliament is expected to pass a new criminal code this month that will penalize sex outside marriage with a punishment of up to one year in jail, officials have confirmed to Reuters.

title: Binance investigates possible hacks of two crypto tokens
description: The crypto industry just can't catch a break this year.

title: Huge fish-shaped rock emerges from the desert
description: In the shimmering heat of the Saudi desert, it could be dismissed as a mirage -- but photographer Khaled Al Enazi. has the pictures to prove he really did spot a giant fish-shaped rock emerging from the sands.

title: Air Canada launches North America's only nonstop flight to Bangkok
description: For the first time in 10 years, there's now a nonstop flight between North America and the capital of one of the world's most popular tourist destinations, Thailand.

title: Russia told US about Brittney Griner's transfer to penal colony weeks after she was moved
The incredible true story of the time an astronaut played golf on the moon
description: February 6, 1971, was a relatively uneventful day for US sports.

title: Kanye West's Twitter account has been suspended after Elon Musk says it violated rule against incitement to violence
description: Kanye West's Twitter account was suspended early Friday morning after Elon Musk said it violated the platform's rules on inciting violence.

title: After a series of confusing statements released by police on the Idaho student killings, here's where the investigation stands
description: As many University of Idaho students returned to campus this week, the police investigation into the stabbing deaths of four of their peers continued -- but not without confusion over a key case detail.

title: Meinhard von Gerkan, German architect who designed Berlin airport, dies at 87
description: Meinhard von Gerkan, one of Germany's most famous architects who designed Berlin's Tegel Airport and the capital's main railway station, has died at age 87, his office said on Thursday.

title: Chinese police are using cellphone data to track down protesters
description:
• China's cities are running out of cash to pay huge Covid lockdown bills
• Opinion: China protesters' comic ingenuity

title: Analysis: Trump's classic delay and divert legal strategy is running out of road
description: A trio of new defeats extended former President Donald Trump's legal losing streak as he seeks to delay or avoid scrutiny over his hoarding of classified documents and his 2020 election chicanery.

title: Wife killer Chris Dawson jailed for 24 years by Australian court
description: A former high school teacher found guilty of killing his wife in one of Australia's longest cold cases has been sentenced to 24 years in prison.

title: Hear what Biden said about a potential meeting with Putin
description: During French President Emmanuel Macron's visit to the White House, he and President Biden talked heavily about Russia's war in Ukraine. CNN's Phil Mattingly reports what Biden said about meeting with Putin.

title: 'A stunning rebuke': Legal analysts react to Mar-a-Lago ruling
description: Former special counsel at the Department of Defense Ryan Goodman and former Nixon White House counsel John Dean explain to CNN's Erin Burnett why a federal appeals court decision to halt a special master review of documents seized from Mar-a-Lago estate is a "direct blow" to former President Donald Trump's case.

title: Heavyweights Germany eliminated after extraordinary finale
description:
• World No. 2 Belgium also eliminated
• Uruguay and Ghana set for epic rematch 12 years after controversial clash

title: Obama pauses his speech to let a 4-year-old say a few words
description: President Obama rallies in Atlanta for Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock ahead of the runoff election when he interrupts his own speech to let a four-year-old say a few words.

title: Rape case that shook Australian politics abandoned over mental health fears
description: Prosecutors in Australia have ended high-profile legal action against a former government staffer accused of raping a colleague inside Parliament House, saying a retrial would pose a "significant and unacceptable risk" to the woman's life.

title: Russia's notorious Wagner group admits to recruiting Zambian inmate who died fighting in Ukraine
description: The owner of Russia's notorious Wagner Group, Yevgeny Prigozhin, admits to recruiting a prisoner from Zambia who died fighting in Ukraine. CNN's Fred Pleitgen reports.

title: Modi urges unity on climate change, terrorism, pandemics as India assumes G20 presidency
description: The world must cooperate to tackle the greatest challenges of climate change, terrorism, and pandemics, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said Thursday as India began its year-long presidency of the Group of 20.

title: US sanctions three North Korean officials tied to weapons of mass destruction program
description: The US Treasury Department on Thursday sanctioned three North Korean officials tied to the nation's weapons of mass destruction program.

title: Otherworldly images from the British Ecological Society photography competition
description: A Helena's tree frog, camouflaged against bark except for its glowing golden eyes, has been named as the overall winner of this year's British Ecological Society photography competition, organizers have announced.

title: Takeaways from the ruling rebuking Donald Trump and the appointment of a special master
description: The appeals court ruling throwing out the special master process that had been put in place for the Mar-a-Lago search was a major rebuke of former President Donald Trump's arguments for why the materials seized from his home should be subject to outside review.

title: The greatest team to never win the World Cup? How the Brazil side of 1982 became one of the most beloved in history
description: Whenever Socrates walked out onto the pitch, all eyes were on the man they called 'Doctor.'

title: What color is 2023?
description: Since 2000, the Pantone Color Institute has annually announced a "Color of the Year." As a new shade is unveiled, what can it tell us about the future?

title: Pantone's 2023 Color of the Year revealed
description: Pantone has spoken. The color that will shape the year ahead is — drum roll, please — Viva Magenta.
